author: gakonst
content: does anyone have any opinions on the usage of protobufs/grpc for internal services communication in akula/erigon? vs doing something custom w/o codegen

author: sky.cactus
content: I have lots of weak opinions.  If the expectation is that the services will usually be on the same network, so bandwidth doesn't really matter, then something human readable has value for debugging.

author: sky.cactus
content: People often underestimate the amount of time spent debugging things (both developers and users).

author: sky.cactus
content: Using preexisting tooling is also incredibly valuable.  In general, if you are going to be doing some kind of serialization, I tend to recommend something standard.  That being said, if the protocol is very simple, something like protobuf/grpc is likely way overkill and it kinda sucks requiring people integrate large SDKs just to serialize some numbers.
